item.title: 黑客攻击汽车经销商，Brookfield Business Partners业绩下滑
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德商业合伙公司（Brookfield Business Partners LP）的主要投资项目之一--一家汽车经销商软件供应商--遭遇网络攻击后，该公司的连败态势得以延续。【原文：Brookfield Business Partners LP extended a losing streak after one of its top investments, a software provider for car dealerships, fell victim to a cyberattack.】

item.title: 如果美联储 7 月降息概率上升，两家大型博彩公司将从中受益
item.description: 美联储基金期货市场上的两笔大额押注抛开了市场对美联储首次降息的共识，从而吸引了华尔街的关注。【原文：A pair of large bets in the fed funds futures market are attracting attention on Wall Street by setting aside the market-implied consensus for the Federal Reserve’s first interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 杰富瑞（Jefferies）称兰特是比索下跌后的套利新宠
item.description: 据杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：The South African rand is emerging as the new favorite bet against the low-yielder Japanese yen, stealing the spotlight from the Mexican peso for the lucrative carry trade, according to Jefferies Financial Group Inc.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会主席根斯勒称英国和其他市场应加快货币结算速度
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会主席正在鼓励英国和其他国家缩短货币交易的结算时间，使其市场与亚洲和北美市场更好地接轨。【原文：The head of the Securities and Exchange Commission is encouraging the UK and others to shorten the settlement time for currency trading to better align their markets with those in Asia and North America.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利和美国银行将 ASMI 评为欧洲人工智能赢家
item.description: 由于摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）和美国银行（Bank of America）的分析师更加看好这家荷兰公司在人工智能热潮中的作用，ASM International NV 的股价创下历史新高。【原文：ASM International NV shares hit a record high as analysts at Morgan Stanley and Bank of America turned more bullish on the Dutch company’s role in the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 欧洲私人信贷投资者因担心违约而放弃额外杠杆
item.description: 欧洲的私人信贷投资者正在放弃杠杆投资，试图在潜在的违约潮中抢占先机。【原文：Private credit investors in Europe are abandoning leveraged plays to try to get ahead of a potential wave of defaults.】

item.title: 欧洲将暂时接收俄罗斯天然气，担心天然气供应中断
item.description: 尽管市场参与者担心，如果向俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom PJSC）付款受到抑制，俄罗斯天然气供应就会停止，但欧洲仍将在周五照常获得俄罗斯天然气供应。【原文：Europe is set to receive its usual Russian gas supplies on Friday, despite fears among market participants that they would be halted if payments to Gazprom PJSC were inhibited.】

item.title: 加拿大购房者利用可调整贷款期待更多利率下调
item.description: 加拿大购房者越来越多地选择浮动利率抵押贷款，因为人们预期政策制定者将进一步降低借贷成本。【原文：Canadian homebuyers are increasingly opting for variable-rate mortgages as expectations build that policymakers are about to provide further relief on borrowing costs.】

item.title: 加密货币 "二级市场 "价格跳涨，首次公开募股预期攀升
item.description: 加密基金和私人投资者一直在抢购私人数字资产公司的股票，因为他们预计其中一些公司可能会在未来几个月内上市。【原文：Crypto funds and private investors have been snapping up shares of private digital-asset companies in anticipation that some of them could be going public in the coming months.】

item.title: Vertex 公司与英国国家医疗服务系统达成囊性纤维化药物定价协议
item.description: Vertex 制药公司与英国国民健康服务局就其囊性纤维化药物达成了定价协议，结束了患者长达数年的争取获得这些药物的运动。【原文：Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc. has reached a pricing deal for its cystic fibrosis drugs with the National Health Service in England, ending a yearslong campaign by patients to secure access to the medicines.】

item.title: 交易商关注供应短缺，咖啡创两周来最大涨幅
item.description: 由于市场关注越南的供应困境和恶劣天气，伦敦和纽约的咖啡期货上涨。【原文：Coffee futures rose in London and New York as markets focused on supply woes and adverse weather in Vietnam.】

item.title: 英国银行不再为本国小型油气生产商提供融资
item.description: 海王星能源公司（Neptune Energy）称，不再有一家英国银行为规模较小的独立石油和天然气生产商提供融资，而这些生产商在北海的产量和投资中占了大头。【原文：There is no longer a single British bank financing the smaller independent oil and gas producers that account for the bulk of output and investment in the North Sea, according to Neptune Energy.】

item.title: Aurubis 董事会重组后任命 Toralf Haag 为新首席执行官
item.description: 铜生产商奥鲁比斯公司（Aurubis AG）已任命托拉尔夫-哈格（Toralf Haag）为新任首席执行官，完成了在巨额原材料欺诈案后对董事会的全面调整。【原文：Copper producer Aurubis AG has named Toralf Haag as its new chief executive, completing an overhaul of its board in the wake of a giant raw-materials fraud.】

item.title: 英伟达击溃科技股质疑者，再次引发对泡沫的担忧
item.description:
华尔街没有人愿意 "挡住货运列车的去路"。然而...... 

No one on Wall Street wants to ‘stand in the way of that freight train.’ And yet … 

】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）称，欧盟新债务规则只有在政治支持下才能发挥作用
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）表示，新的欧盟财政规则只有在债务水平高、预算赤字大的国家做出真正的物质和政治努力，使其公共财政正常运转的情况下才能发挥作用。【原文：New European Union fiscal rules will only work if countries with high levels of debt and wide budget deficits make a real material and political effort to get their public finances in order, the International Monetary Fund said.】

item.title: AXA IM 减持法国银行股，债券风险成为持久趋势
item.description: 投资组合经理吉勒-吉博特（Gilles Guibout）表示，安盛投资管理公司（AXA Investment Managers）已经削减了对法国银行股的投资，并认为近期主权收益率的上升不会迅速逆转。【原文：AXA Investment Managers has cut its exposure to French banking stocks and sees no quick reversal in the recent rise in sovereign yields, according to portfolio manager Gilles Guibout.】

item.title: 抛开利润不谈，IPO 投资者为收入增长买单
item.description: 投资者对首次公开募股反弹的渴望如此强烈，以至于他们再次愿意牺牲利润来换取收入增长，并为参与首次公开募股预留了资金。【原文：Investors are so hungry for initial public offerings to rebound that they are once again willing to sacrifice profit for revenue growth — and have set aside money for the privilege of participating.】

item.title: 意大利就中国汽车冒充意大利汽车开出 600 万欧元罚单
item.description: 意大利反垄断机构对一家当地汽车公司处以 600 万欧元（约合 640 万美元）的罚款，因为该公司认定包括奇瑞汽车公司在内的中国制造商生产的汽车被非法误标为意大利制造。【原文：Italy’s antitrust authority fined a local automobile company €6 million ($6.4 million) after determining that vehicles originating from Chinese manufacturers including Chery Automobile Co. were illegally mislabeled as Italian-made.】

item.title: Raising Cane 的亿万富翁创始人以纳什维尔的顶层公寓创下纪录
item.description: Raising Cane 的创始人托德-格雷夫斯（Todd Graves）正在购买纳什维尔有史以来最昂贵的公寓。【原文：Raising Cane’s founder Todd Graves is buying the most expensive condo ever sold in Nashville.】

item.title: 西班牙法官称 BBVA 应接受公司间谍案审判
item.description: 西班牙一名调查法官表示，毕尔巴鄂 Vizcaya Argentaria 银行应接受审判，作为企业间谍指控刑事调查的一部分。【原文：Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria SA should stand trial as part of a criminal inquiry over allegations of corporate spying, an investigative Spanish judge said.】

item.title: 莱茵金属获得创纪录的 85 亿欧元弹药供应订单
item.description: 德国莱茵金属公司（Rheinmetall AG）获得了一份 85 亿欧元（约合 91 亿美元）的订单，将向德国军队提供火炮弹药，这是该公司历史上最大的一份合同，因为各国政府正竞相储备弹药，以支持乌克兰抵御俄罗斯入侵的防御行动。【原文：Rheinmetall AG received an €8.5 billion ($9.1 billion) order to deliver artillery ammunition to the German army, the biggest contract in the company’s history, as governments race to stock up and support Ukraine’s defense campaign against Russia’s invasion.】

item.title: 在美国造东西如此困难的原因
item.description:
与约翰-阿诺德的对话。【原文：

A conversation with John Arnold.

】

item.title: 拉扎德寻求私人信贷收购以加强资产管理
item.description: 拉扎德公司（Lazard Inc. ）正在权衡收购一家私人信贷公司的若干机会，这将有助于扩大其价值 2,500 亿美元的资产管理部门，从而成为华尔街银行在这一热门领域寻求进军的最新一家银行。【原文：Lazard Inc. is weighing several opportunities to acquire a private-credit firm that would help expand its $250 billion asset-management arm, becoming the latest Wall Street bank to seek inroads in the buzzy sector.】

item.title: 巴西通过发行可持续债券开拓全球市场
item.description: 巴西今年第二次利用全球债券市场，加入了一连串出售新债的发展中国家行列。【原文：Brazil is tapping global bond markets for the second time this year, joining a string of developing nations selling new debt.】

item.title: 全球紧张局势加剧，摩根士丹利将目光投向拉丁美洲
item.description: 摩根士丹利正在增加对拉丁美洲的投资，因为世界其他地区的地缘政治冲突使该地区在全球经济中的地位日益突出。【原文：Morgan Stanley is increasing its investments in Latin America as geopolitical conflicts elsewhere in the world give the region increasing prominence in the global economy.】

item.title: 莫迪新政府首次就印度考试问题遭到抗议
item.description: 印度医学院全国入学考试因涉嫌腐败而引发众怒，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪面临着组建政府后的第一个挑战。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi is facing his first challenge after forming the government as a national entrance exam for admission to India’s medical colleges sparked outrage over allegations of corruption.】

item.title: 在交易员的刺激下，石油市场终于尝到了夏季反弹的滋味
item.description: 石油市场至少在期待已久的夏季反弹中尝到了一点甜头。【原文：Oil markets are getting at least a small taste of a much-anticipated summer rally.】

item.title: 欧洲首次公开募股（IPO）复苏受阻，收购公司畏缩不前
item.description: 由于私募股权投资公司对公司上市越来越紧张，欧洲首次公开募股市场的反弹正在减弱。【原文：A rebound in Europe’s initial public offerings market is faltering as private equity firms are getting increasingly nervous about taking companies public.】

item.title: 印度拒绝向法国记者颁发许可证，新闻自由遭受打击
item.description: 据称，印度拒绝为一名法国记者续签许可证，使他成为今年第三位离开印度的记者，这被视为纳伦德拉-莫迪总理领导的印度政府对新闻自由的又一次打击。【原文：India has allegedly refused to renew a French correspondent’s permit, making him the third journalist to leave India this year, in what’s seen as another blow to press freedom in the country under Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government.】

item.title: 卖方正在进入市场"，S&P 在科技领域屡遭挫折
item.description: 除去推动 S&P 500 指数不断创下历史新高的几家大型科技公司，该指数的引擎似乎正在熄火。【原文：Take out the few big tech companies that keep pushing the S&P 500 Index to all time highs and it looks like the engine is running on fumes.】
